summary: The document is a design specification for the Employee Central module of the Human Resources Management Information System (HRMIS) for WA Health, aiming to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution. It outlines the program's context, objectives, and key design elements, including platform selection (SAP SuccessFactors), organizational structure, employee data management, workflows, permissions, and reporting. The document also details custom requirements such as delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management. It serves as a foundational reference for the implementation and delivery phase, ensuring alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main goal of the HRMIS Employee Central module for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The main goal is to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors was selected as the platform.

qa_pairs.question: What are some key design elements outlined in the document?
qa_pairs.answer: Key design elements include platform selection, organizational structure, employee data management, workflows, permissions, and reporting.

qa_pairs.question: What custom requirements are detailed in the design document?
qa_pairs.answer: Custom requirements include delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Employee Central Design Document?
qa_pairs.answer: It serves as a foundational reference for the implementation and delivery phase, ensuring alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main goal of the HRMIS Program for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The main goal is to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution that is more reliable, efficient, user-friendly, and supports system-wide workforce reporting and planning.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module in the HRMIS?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors was selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: Who is leading the implementation and delivery of the HRMIS Program?
qa_pairs.answer: Health Support Services (HSS) is leading the implementation and delivery in partnership with Deloitte.

qa_pairs.question: What are the five discrete stages of the HRMIS Program implementation?
qa_pairs.answer: The five stages are Mobilisation, Design, Build, Test, and Deployment.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Employee Central Design Document?
qa_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide an overview of the Employee Central design for HRMIS, complementing detailed design workbooks and mapping requirements from the Requirements Traceability Matrix.

qa_pairs.question: What approach does the HRMIS Program take regarding software customisation?
qa_pairs.answer: The program uses commercial-off-the-shelf software with limited customisations, relying on configurations and base product functionality.

qa_pairs.question: How will position titles be managed in the new HRMIS solution?
qa_pairs.answer: Position titles will be a validated list mapped and grouped at the ANZSCO minor group category level to aid filtering and selection.

qa_pairs.question: What is the assumed solution for organisation modelling in HRMIS?
qa_pairs.answer: It is assumed that Ingentis org.manager will be used for organisation modelling and integrated with SuccessFactors EC.

qa_pairs.question: What custom requirements are mentioned for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: Custom requirements include delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management.

qa_pairs.question: How are assumptions managed during the HRMIS implementation program?
qa_pairs.answer: All assumptions are captured and managed in JIRA.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main purpose of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module aims to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution for WA Health.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: What are some of the key business objects and processes supported by Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Employee Central supports organisational structure, personal information, employment information, employee and manager self-service, job information, compensation management, long term absences, pay component management, and employee skills, qualifications, and certificates.

qa_pairs.question: How does Employee Central interact with other systems in the HRMIS?
qa_pairs.answer: Employee Central supplies relevant employee and organisation data to Employee Central Payroll, UKG Dimensions (Scheduling), and other downstream systems.

qa_pairs.question: What is the role of the platform module in SAP SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: The platform module underpins all other modules, providing shared content and functionality, and allows for scalable addition of more modules.

qa_pairs.question: What are some custom tiles identified for the Employee Central home page?
qa_pairs.answer: Custom tiles include quick access to UKG Dimensions Rostering, Health Service Provider’s Health Point site, Learning Management System, Incident Management System, Employee Central Payroll GUI, Trim and Objective document management systems, GESB website, and direct access to payslips.

qa_pairs.question: What are the main process areas covered by Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: The main process areas are Organisation Structure and Position Maintenance, Employee Data Administration, and Manage Workforce.

qa_pairs.question: What are foundation objects in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Foundation objects are the building blocks of employee records, used to set up data shared across the business, such as organisation structure objects, positions, locations, cost centres, pay scales, and job classifications.

qa_pairs.question: How many levels of organisation objects does SuccessFactors Employee Central offer under a Legal Entity?
qa_pairs.answer: SuccessFactors Employee Central offers 3 standard levels of organisation objects under a Legal Entity, but WA Health adds several more to support its organisational complexity.

qa_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'Governing Body' in the WA Health organisation structure?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'Governing Body' is defined as the Public Sector Agency in the WA Health organisation structure.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of assigning unique number ranges to organisation objects in the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: Unique number ranges are assigned to organisation objects so they are easily identifiable in reporting and no two objects will have the same ID number.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central module in WA Health's HRMIS?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: What add-on will be implemented to provide enhanced organisation modelling functionality in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Ingentis org.manager will be implemented as an add-on to provide organisation modelling functionality and enhanced organisation view.

qa_pairs.question: Who will have permission to view the future state Organisation Structure in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: The establishment team responsible for applying Organisation Changes will have permission to view the future state Organisation Structure.

qa_pairs.question: What is the number range assigned to positions in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Positions are given a unique number range of 20000000 – 29999999.

qa_pairs.question: How are positions created in Employee Central to support WA Health's approach?
qa_pairs.answer: Positions are created with a '1 to 1' relationship model to an employee to support WA Health's approach.

qa_pairs.question: What additional information will be added to the position object to enhance position/data management?
qa_pairs.answer: Additional information includes a picklist for Position Titles, pay scale fields, tier information, full organisation structure information, support for multiple cost centres, compliance checking, multiple funding options, UKG Dimensions fields, MOIR fields, account codes, job codes, and a link to the Job Description Form.

qa_pairs.question: What standard icons will be displayed for positions where relevant?
qa_pairs.answer: Standard icons displayed include Vacancy Indicator, Occupant is acting in the position (Higher Duties), and Occupant is on a Leave of Absence.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of synchronising position data to the employee’s job information portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: Synchronising position data to the employee’s job information portlet enforces strict compliance and ensures that employee data does not depart from the position data, supporting trust and accuracy in position reporting.

qa_pairs.question: What business rule will be developed to help track vacancies in position management?
qa_pairs.answer: A business rule will be developed to provide alerts/reporting for vacancies that are approaching 12 months, prompting the appropriate user to act.

qa_pairs.question: What system will replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module of the Human Resources Management Information System (HRMIS) will replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central solution?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central solution.

qa_pairs.question: How are vacancies that are approaching 12 months handled in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Alerts and reporting are generated for vacancies approaching 12 months to prompt appropriate users to act and maintain accurate positions and statuses.

qa_pairs.question: What business rule is applied to positions marked as 'frozen'?
qa_pairs.answer: Business rules are applied to prevent employees from being moved into positions marked as 'frozen' by mistake.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the 'right to return' functionality?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'right to return' functionality enables clear tracking of employees due to return to a certain position after leave of absence or higher duties.

qa_pairs.question: How are locations managed in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Locations are held as foundation objects and can be grouped, with data such as addresses and phone numbers flowing to positions and employees, and shared with downstream systems.

qa_pairs.question: Where are cost centres mastered and how are they integrated into Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Cost centres are mastered in the Finance Management Information System (FMIS) and automatically supplied into Employee Central daily.

qa_pairs.question: Can cost centres be maintained against the employee only?
qa_pairs.answer: No, cost centres cannot be maintained against the employee only; they are maintained against the position and changes flow down to the employee.

qa_pairs.question: What tool is used to build job profiles in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'job profile builder' tool in SuccessFactors is used to build complete job profiles with multiple content types.

qa_pairs.question: How are account and job codes managed in the solution?
qa_pairs.answer: Account and job codes are derived from Finance, mastered on the position, flow to the employee record, and are replicated to Employee Central Payroll and Finance.

qa_pairs.question: What are the four fields that comprise the pay scale structure?
qa_pairs.answer: The pay scale structure comprises Pay Scale Type, Pay Scale Area, Pay Scale Group, and Pay Scale Level.

qa_pairs.question: What unique identifier is assigned to employees during the hire process?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees are assigned a unique HE Number during the hire process.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system handle rehires?
qa_pairs.answer: If an employee leaves and returns, they are rehired into the same HE Number.

qa_pairs.question: How are employees with multiple assignments managed?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees with multiple assignments retain a single HE Number but are assigned unique AssignmentIDs and User IDs for each employment.

qa_pairs.question: What is recorded in the audit log for employee data changes?
qa_pairs.answer: The audit log records the employee making the change, the data, and the time of the change.

qa_pairs.question: How quickly are employee data changes replicated to other systems?
qa_pairs.answer: Employee data changes are replicated to UKG Dimensions and Employee Central Payroll within a few minutes of approval.

qa_pairs.question: What are the three main sections of the profile screen in the Employee Central system?
qa_pairs.answer: The three main sections are Personal Information, Employment and Job Information, and Talent/Other information.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system handle employees with concurrent employments?
qa_pairs.answer: Radio buttons in the header of the employee profile allow toggling between job information details for each concurrent employment.

qa_pairs.question: What information is included in the personal information section of the profile?
qa_pairs.answer: It includes personal information, national ID, work eligibility, biographical information, address, contact information, emergency contact, dependents, COVID vaccine information, bank details, position compliance, and skills and qualifications.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between planned and unplanned higher duties in the HRMIS solution?
qa_pairs.answer: Planned higher duties last more than 5 days and are managed in Employee Central, while unplanned higher duties are for short periods and managed in the UKG Dimensions scheduling system.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system ensure employees do not exceed allowed working hours across multiple employments?
qa_pairs.answer: Business rules are implemented to ensure the total number of hours across all employments does not exceed those set out in the relevant industrial agreements.

qa_pairs.question: How are contingent workers identified in the system, given the limitations of the standard module?
qa_pairs.answer: Contingent workers are identified by a specific employee class called 'External', and suitable defaults are applied for mandatory fields that are not relevant.

qa_pairs.question: What happens when an employee changes their legal first or last name in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: The employee must attach evidence, and a workflow is triggered for validation and approval.

qa_pairs.question: How does the address information portlet handle international addresses?
qa_pairs.answer: The address country defaults to Australia but can be changed; the address screen then displays fields specific to the selected country.

qa_pairs.question: What system is being used for the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors is being used for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system handle address fields for employees?
qa_pairs.answer: The system shows address fields specific to the country specified and implements enhanced validation for data compliance.

qa_pairs.question: What validation is applied to the National ID (TFN) portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: Standard validation prevents invalid TFNs, and temporary TFN functionality ensures only valid temporary IDs are entered.

qa_pairs.question: What notifications are implemented for work eligibility data?
qa_pairs.answer: The system sends notifications at specific lead-in times to notify relevant parties of upcoming expiry dates for work eligibility documents.

qa_pairs.question: What type of information is stored in the Biographical Information portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: The Biographical Information portlet contains personal information that does not change over time, such as HE Number and date of birth.

qa_pairs.question: How is phone number data validated in the Contact Information portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: Enhanced validation is implemented to store phone numbers in a defined format, such as XXXX XXX XXX for mobile numbers.

qa_pairs.question: Can employees add multiple emergency contacts?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, employees can add multiple emergency contact details, including relationships.

qa_pairs.question: What flexibility do employees have regarding bank details?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees can enter multiple banks, designate a main bank, and specify amounts or percentages for other bank accounts. They can also capture different bank details for each employment.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system manage COVID vaccine information?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees can maintain their COVID vaccination status and add multiple booster information in a repeating field.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Position Compliance portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: The Position Compliance portlet displays the results of checks between employee work eligibility data and position requirements, listing requirements and employee status.

qa_pairs.question: What data is included in the Skills and Certifications portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: The Skills and Certifications portlet contains relevant skills and certifications data that will flow through to UKG Dimensions for rostering.

qa_pairs.question: Which portlets can employees update directly in Employee Central without workflow?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees can update Address Information, National ID, Biographical Information, Contact Information, Emergency Contact Information, Dependents Information, Bank Details, COVID Vaccine Information, Mobility Preferences, and Languages Spoken directly in Employee Central without workflow.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Employment Details portlet in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employment Details portlet contains key dates pertaining to the employment, such as start date, annual leave, long service leave, and WA Health specific dates like Government Start Date and Increment Anniversary Date.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system handle job information for employees with multiple employments?
qa_pairs.answer: Employment and job information will exist for each employment if the employee holds more than one employment.

qa_pairs.question: What happens when an employee is assigned to a position in terms of job information?
qa_pairs.answer: A large amount of information is mastered on the position and then copied onto the employee’s job information record, with most fields set to read-only to keep the position as the source of truth.

qa_pairs.question: What are Job Relationships in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Job Relationships allow the recording of additional managers or HR representatives associated with the employee, including Matrix Managers who have the same permissions as line managers.

qa_pairs.question: How many cost centres can be maintained against an employee in the standard Cost Distribution portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: The standard Cost Distribution portlet allows 12 cost centres to be maintained against an employee.

qa_pairs.question: What is the function of the compensation information portlet?
qa_pairs.answer: The compensation information portlet contains payment-related data for an employee, including recurring and non-recurring payments, and ensures compliance with award amounts.

qa_pairs.question: How are non-employees like Volunteers and Contractors identified in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Non-employees are identified by the Employee Class and Employment Type values, and additional fields such as Vendor and Contractor Fee are available for them.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of events and event reasons in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Events and event reasons are used to capture employee actions that can be reported on, set user status, and drive processes and rule-based workflow scenarios.

qa_pairs.question: What system is being implemented to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module of the Human Resources Management Information System (HRMIS) is being implemented to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: How can pay components be maintained in the Employee Central system?
qa_pairs.answer: Pay components can be manually maintained against each employee or mass loaded via an import file or interface.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between recurring and non-recurring payments in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Recurring payments are pay components paid to the employee every fortnight, while non-recurring payments are paid as once-off payments.

qa_pairs.question: What happens to an employee's status in Employee Central when they are terminated?
qa_pairs.answer: Once an employee is terminated in the system, their status is automatically set to inactive and they will no longer be able to access the system.

qa_pairs.question: Who can initiate the termination process in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: The termination process can be started by the employee, manager, or administrator.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if a fixed term employee's contract end date is reached?
qa_pairs.answer: Once the contract end date is reached, the employee will be automatically terminated.

qa_pairs.question: What integration occurs after an employee is terminated in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Integration with downstream systems such as UKGD, Payroll, and Active Directory will occur to ensure the termination is effective in all systems.

qa_pairs.question: What are some of the termination reasons configured in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Some termination reasons include Promotion, Transfer, Redeployment, Secondment, Resigned, Retirement, Deceased, Dismissed, Voluntary Redundancy, Cessation of Fixed Term, and Covid 19 Vaccine – NC.

qa_pairs.question: How does Employee Central handle alerts and notifications?
qa_pairs.answer: Employee Central can send time-based alerts to users in the system and via email based on business rule criteria, with notifications and lead times adjustable by authorized users.

qa_pairs.question: What are some processes that generate alert notifications in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Processes that generate alert notifications include vacant positions, contract expiry, probation expiry, work permit/eligibility expiry, tax file declaration, higher duty end dates, temporary deployment end dates, secondment end dates, and skills maintenance.

qa_pairs.question: What workflow enhancement is included in Employee Central to meet business requirements?
qa_pairs.answer: An enhancement to the standard SuccessFactors workflow engine is included to meet the delegation of authority requirement.

qa_pairs.question: What tool allows managers to delegate workflow approvals in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Managers have access to the standard Workflow Delegation Tool to specify an employee to receive and act on their workflows for a specified time.

qa_pairs.question: What can administrators do with the 'manage Workflow' admin tool in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Administrators can identify stalled workflows, look up workflow status using filters, and reassign workflow steps to different approvers if required.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main platform selected for the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors is the main platform selected for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the admin user maintainable configuration table in workflow business rules?
qa_pairs.answer: It is used to keep business rules simple and maintenance minimal.

qa_pairs.question: What is a key requirement for delegation in the HRMIS Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: A user can only select another user as a delegate if they are on the same Delegation of Authority Tier level or higher.

qa_pairs.question: What happens when a person is nominated and accepts to be a delegate for another person?
qa_pairs.answer: They inherit all the authorisations of the person for whom they are performing delegations in terms of approvals.

qa_pairs.question: What system is used for access control within SuccessFactors Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: Standard SuccessFactors Role Based Permission (RBP) is used for all access control.

qa_pairs.question: What do RBP Groups define in the context of Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: RBP Groups define a population of employees.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between Granted Groups and Target Groups in RBP?
qa_pairs.answer: Granted Groups receive the authorisation, while Target Groups are the population that the Granted Group may action on.

qa_pairs.question: What is the role of the 'EMP_ALL_BASIC' RBP Role Group?
qa_pairs.answer: It provides basic user system access to everyone, including publicly viewable employee data, login, and search permissions.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the 'Proxy' feature in delegation?
qa_pairs.answer: It allows administrators to set up delegation on behalf of a manager or other employee.

qa_pairs.question: What special permission is required for managers to initiate a Transfer or Higher Duties event on an employee?
qa_pairs.answer: Special permission is required for all managers to allow a 'Receiving Manager' to initiate these events, as normally only the 'Releasing Manager' can do so.

qa_pairs.question: What platform has been selected for the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: How does SuccessFactors ensure report data security based on user roles?
qa_pairs.answer: Reports in SuccessFactors strictly adhere to Role Based Permissions, showing only data the user is authorized to see.

qa_pairs.question: What reporting tools are available to users in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Users can create and run reports using the Ad-Hoc reporting tool or People Stories advanced reporting.

qa_pairs.question: Can users without report creation permissions still access reports in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, users without permission to create reports can execute shared reports if they have the required permission.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Report Stories dashboards in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Report Stories dashboards allow users to drill down and view underlying data.

qa_pairs.question: What types of compensation reports are available from the SAP Store?
qa_pairs.answer: Available compensation reports include Annual Compensation Analysis, Gender Pay Gap Analysis, Non-Recurring Pay History, Payment Information, and Recurring Pay History.

qa_pairs.question: What employment-related reports are available in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Employment-related reports include Age and Length of Service Ranges, Alternative Cost Distribution, Job Changes and Anniversaries, Company Address Book, Direct Reports, Job Relationships, Hires Analysis, Manager Analysis, Terminated Employment Analysis, Workforce Analysis, Work Eligibility, Employee Hierarchy, Headcount and FTE, Multiple Employments, and Turnover Analysis.

qa_pairs.question: What personal information reports can be generated in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Personal information reports include Dependants List, Employee Emergency Contacts, and Private Contact, Phone and Email Information.

qa_pairs.question: What workflow management reports are available in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Workflow management reports include Open Workflow Requests, Workflow Processing Statistics, and Workflow Request Analysis.

qa_pairs.question: How can data be exported from SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Data can be exported to Excel or CSV files, and the Integration Centre allows sending data to downstream systems via SFTP or API.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Document Generation in SuccessFactors?
qa_pairs.answer: Document Generation allows authorized personnel to generate system HR letters in predefined formats, saving manual effort and approval time.

qa_pairs.question: Which documents have been identified as required for the EC solution?
qa_pairs.answer: The required documents include Certificate of Service (for all employees) and Deceased Employee Letter (for appropriate admins only).

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module aims to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central solution?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main reason for implementing a custom Delegation of Authority (DOA) workflow?
qa_pairs.answer: A custom DOA workflow is required because standard EC workflow functionality cannot navigate the position structure referencing custom fields to the needed level of detail.

qa_pairs.question: How will the custom DOA workflow determine which workflow to trigger?
qa_pairs.answer: The business rule will query data on the employee’s job information record to read a configuration table (MDF object), which returns the id of the workflow to be triggered.

qa_pairs.question: What standard functionality will be included for managing certificates and licenses?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees will be able to upload certificates and license data, attach relevant documents, and initiate a workflow to validate the data before saving the record.

qa_pairs.question: What new feature will be created to manage skills and qualifications?
qa_pairs.answer: A new MDF portlet will be created to hold Skills and Qualification data.

qa_pairs.question: What information must employees provide when uploading a license via Employee Self-Service?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees must select the Licence Type, Date of Issue, Expiry Date, and attach a scan of the licence.

qa_pairs.question: What does the automatic increment program in the payroll system do?
qa_pairs.answer: It evaluates employees due for their next increment, considers higher duties and leave types, updates increment levels, applies deferrals if criteria are not met, and reports exceptions.

qa_pairs.question: How is the Country Relief/Special Temporary Placement solution delivered?
qa_pairs.answer: It is delivered via the Employee Central MDF (Meta Data Framework) as a custom solution.

qa_pairs.question: Who can create a Shortfall Vacancy campaign in the Country Relief/Special Temporary Placement process?
qa_pairs.answer: Only managers with the required permission can create a Shortfall Vacancy campaign.

qa_pairs.question: What fields are auto-populated after a Position Number is specified in a Shortfall Vacancy campaign?
qa_pairs.answer: Fields such as Legal Entity, Region, Service Hospital Name, Function, Department, Unit, Pay Scale Type, Pay Scale Group, Pay Scale Level, Job Code, Hours Per Week, Working Days Per Week, Gender and EEO Requirements, and Position Requirements are auto-populated.

qa_pairs.question: What system is being designed to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module of the Human Resources Management Information System (HRMIS) is being designed to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems for WA Health.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform has been selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors has been selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: How are employees relevant for Country Relief identified?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees relevant for Country Relief are identified via an Employee Group based on their Employment Type and Legal Entity.

qa_pairs.question: What happens when an employee applies for a shortfall position?
qa_pairs.answer: A workflow is initiated to the relevant Admin team for processing, and the Admin team receives a notification that an employee has applied for a position.

qa_pairs.question: Where will AHPRA information be stored after the requirement for an AHPRA portlet was removed?
qa_pairs.answer: AHPRA information will be held in the new credentialling system (cGov) and relevant details will flow into Employee Central.

qa_pairs.question: What custom portlet allows employees to initiate a Workers Compensation claim?
qa_pairs.answer: A custom portlet available to employees allows them to initiate a Workers Compensation claim.

qa_pairs.question: How can employees update their superannuation details?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees can create or update their superannuation details using a custom portlet on the people profile page, which then workflows to the payroll team for validation and approval.

qa_pairs.question: How is COVID vaccine tracking managed in Employee Central?
qa_pairs.answer: COVID vaccine tracking is managed through a portlet that allows the number of jabs to be added as required, making it future-proof.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Purchase Leave portlet or form?
qa_pairs.answer: The Purchase Leave portlet or form allows employees to raise a purchase leave request, capturing the hours requested and routing the request to the appropriate approver(s).

qa_pairs.question: How are employee claims and allowances processed?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees submit claims via Employee Self Service, which are routed to the appropriate authoriser, and once approved, the claim is updated in Employee Central and replicated to the payroll system.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main purpose of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module aims to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors was selected as the platform for the Employee Central module.

qa_pairs.question: What key organizational features are included in the Employee Central design?
qa_pairs.answer: Key features include organizational structure, employee data management, workflows, permissions, and reporting.

qa_pairs.question: What are some custom requirements detailed in the Employee Central design?
qa_pairs.answer: Custom requirements include delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management.

qa_pairs.question: How does the Employee Central design document support the implementation phase?
qa_pairs.answer: It serves as a foundational reference to ensure alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.

qa_pairs.question: What is the main purpose of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module aims to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors was selected as the platform.

qa_pairs.question: What are some key design elements outlined in the Employee Central design document?
qa_pairs.answer: Key design elements include organizational structure, employee data management, workflows, permissions, and reporting.

qa_pairs.question: What custom requirements are detailed in the design document?
qa_pairs.answer: Custom requirements include delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management.

qa_pairs.question: What is the role of the design document in the implementation phase?
qa_pairs.answer: The design document serves as a foundational reference to ensure alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system handle contract management notifications?
qa_pairs.answer: The system triggers actions and sends notifications for contract expiry and management.

qa_pairs.question: What self-service features are supported by the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Self-service features include reminder notifications, workflow initiation, data validation, approval redirection, and report execution.

qa_pairs.question: Who can maintain or adjust organizational positions in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Only approved or authorized users can maintain or adjust positions.

qa_pairs.question: What permissions do managers have in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Managers can view subordinates' data, initiate and view temporary deployments, and have permissions on subordinates and on behalf of employee actions.

qa_pairs.question: How does the system support employee and manager access to data?
qa_pairs.answer: Employees can view their own data, and managers can view their subordinates' data via Employee Self Service (ESS).

qa_pairs.question: What is the main goal of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: To replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors.

qa_pairs.question: What types of reporting capabilities are included in the Employee Central design?
qa_pairs.answer: Standard reports, user-definable reports, management dashboards with drill-down, and access to reporting via security roles.

qa_pairs.question: What custom requirements are specified in the design document?
qa_pairs.answer: Delegation workflows, compliance tracking, and COVID vaccine management.

qa_pairs.question: Who can configure and execute reports according to the requirements?
qa_pairs.answer: Admins can configure and execute reports.

qa_pairs.question: Can employees run reports via Employee Self Service (ESS)?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, employees can run reports via ESS.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system support access outside of working hours and on personal devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the system supports access outside working hours and on personal devices.

qa_pairs.question: What is the minimum number of concurrent users the system must support?
qa_pairs.answer: At least 20,000 users concurrently.

qa_pairs.question: What audit and security features are included in the self-service module?
qa_pairs.answer: The system provides audit trails and auditable configuration of self-service workflows and rules.

qa_pairs.question: What employee data management features are included?
qa_pairs.answer: Employee attributes, pay information, service history, and document uploads via ESS.

qa_pairs.question: What feature allows users to rapidly navigate the system?
qa_pairs.answer: The system includes a 'fast path' code feature for rapid navigation.

qa_pairs.question: Can self-service be accessed on personal devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, self-service is available to users on personal devices including PCs, phones, and tablets.

qa_pairs.question: Is self-service available outside of working hours?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, self-service must be available outside of working hours.

qa_pairs.question: How is downtime information communicated to users?
qa_pairs.answer: Downtime information such as system maintenance will be published on the portal.

qa_pairs.question: Can users access Employee Self Service (ESS) outside the network?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, access to ESS is available outside the network.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system provide an audit trail for data changes in self-service?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, there is an audit trail on data changes in self-service.

qa_pairs.question: Can system administrators configure self-service menus, screens, and workflows?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, system administrators can configure self-service menus, screens, and workflows.

qa_pairs.question: How many concurrent self-service user sessions can the system support?
qa_pairs.answer: The system can support at least 20,000 self-service user sessions running concurrently.

qa_pairs.question: Can managers view information about their subordinates on a computer?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, managers can view subordinates' information on a computer.

qa_pairs.question: Are reports user-definable and can they report on all fields?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, reports are user-definable and can report on all fields.

qa_pairs.question: In which formats can reports be saved?
qa_pairs.answer: Reports can be saved in CSV and PDF formats.

qa_pairs.question: Can reports be scheduled in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, reports can be scheduled.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system provide predefined report templates?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the system provides predefined report templates.

qa_pairs.question: Can reports be sorted and filtered?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, reports can be sorted and filtered.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system support both hardcopy and softcopy report outputs?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, reports can be generated as both hardcopy and softcopy.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system provide tools for structural analysis and modelling of the organization?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the system provides tools for structural analysis and modelling.

qa_pairs.question: Is each vacancy allocated a unique identifier?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, each vacancy is allocated a unique identifier.

qa_pairs.question: Can the system provide information to monitor and update the progress of filling a vacancy?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the system provides information to monitor and update progress against the process workflow for filling a vacancy.

qa_pairs.question: Can positions be flagged as needing to be filled?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, positions can be flagged as needing to be filled.

qa_pairs.question: Does the system support online management reporting dashboards?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the system supports online management reporting dashboards.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Employee Central module in the HRMIS for WA Health?
qa_pairs.answer: The Employee Central module aims to replace legacy HR, payroll, and rostering systems with a unified, modern solution.

qa_pairs.question: Which platform was selected for the Employee Central module?
qa_pairs.answer: SAP SuccessFactors was selected as the platform.

qa_pairs.question: What does the requirements matrix tracking table indicate about terminated employees accessing self-service menus?
qa_pairs.answer: The system should provide a facility to allow terminated employees to access self-service menus for a period post-termination, but this requirement is not met.

qa_pairs.question: What does 'RBP' stand for in the context of this document?
qa_pairs.answer: 'RBP' stands for Role Based Permission.

qa_pairs.question: What is the function of the Delegation of Authority (DOA) in the system?
qa_pairs.answer: Delegation of Authority (DOA) refers to workflows that allow delegation of responsibilities within the system.

qa_pairs.question: What is the significance of the audit trail in payroll processing updates?
qa_pairs.answer: Payroll processing updates must include an audit trail to track changes.

qa_pairs.question: What does 'ESS' refer to in the glossary?
qa_pairs.answer: 'ESS' refers to Employee Self Service.

qa_pairs.question: Is the requirement for contract expiry to trigger auto actions in scope?
qa_pairs.answer: No, the requirement for contract expiry to trigger auto actions is out of scope.
